sources.full: Esquizofrenia Coletiva com Amigos: Mind Domain

subclassFeature.name: Mind Domain
entries: The domain of Mind is linked to the forces surrounding mind control, manifesting the psychic and aberrant power of the gods of the astral plane in Dungeons & Dragons settings. Deities such as Ilithid, Mind Flayer, and Yog-Sothoth are patrons of mind clerics, who specialize in manipulating minds, causing confusion, and exploring psychic nooks and crannies. In addition, these clerics also channel powers related to visions, cosmic knowledge and deep insight, representing the connection with the mysteries of the astral plane. Gods of the Mind domain also personify intrigue (Tharzidunn), forbidden knowledge (Vecna), and the search for truth beyond mortal comprehension (Cthulhu).

subclassFeature.name: Bonus proficiency
entries: At 1st level of this subclass, you learn two skills in skill tests involving intelligence, and you can add your wisdom bonus to skill tests involving the two chosen.

subclassFeature.name: Divine mind
entries: Also at 1st level, you learn to strike your enemies with mental power. When you cast a spell or cleric trick that inflicts radiant damage, you can choose to inflict psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Mental Bond
entries: At 2nd level, you can use your channeling divinity to expand your psychic power to your allies. You can choose a number of allies equal to your wisdom modifier, and for 1 hour, you and your allies can communicate mentally as long as they are within 60 feet of each other.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Intellectual sense
entries: From 6th level onwards, you can use your divinity channeling to extend your senses beyond what your physical body allows. For 1 minute with your action, you can use your channeling divinity to detect and see any creature that is invisible or on the ethereal plane.

subclassFeature.name: Powerful conjuration
entries: From 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage dealt by any cleric trick, this damage is psychic.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Form
entries: At 17th level, your study and affinity with aberrant creatures has become such that your mind has become one of them. Your creature type is changed to aberration, and you can change your form into any creature that your creature type is aberration, as long as you have already seen that creature.

With your action, you can transform into an aberrant creature that has a challenge level equal to half your cleric level rounded up. You take on all the creature's characteristics, with the exception of its charisma modifier, intelligence and wisdom, and if the creature is a conjurer, it uses its casting attribute instead of the creature's attribute.

All damage received while in aberrant form will be dealt to you when your aberrant form drops to 0 hit points. If you assume the aberrant form of a conjuring creature, you can only cast spells that you have spell slots available to cast and must be the known or innate spells of that creature. Any spell slots cast in aberrant form will also be deducted from your normal form. You can use this ability once per long rest, and you can remain in your aberrant form for 1 minute, or until you use your action to return to normal, or have dropped to 0 hit points.
